column4: how to force a programm starting on e.g. the second workspace? e.g. "firefox &" typed in the bash will start firefox on the same workspace. anybody knows where to find the info? Thanks.
ok, check it out. Will tell you later. Thx so far.

As far as I see no, wmctrl is not the solution. I'm looking for something where I can force anykind of programm to start on the specified workspace, by writing one command in the bash. Any other idea, where to look?
